page.title: 16POSTAL SORTING OFFICE
page.content: In Alwoodley there is a postal sorting office which serves this and surrounding areas.Letters arrive from Leeds Central at 5.30a.m and 10.30a.m. 30,000 to 40,000 letters a day are sorted by hand into the "walks"which are the postman's delivery rounds. He makes 2 delivery rounds each day except Sunday.He needs a signature for registered letters. In 1985 it costs 17p to send a letter by 1st class mail anywhere in the U.K. 2nd class mail costs 13p per letter and usually takes longer to arrive at its destination.If the letters weigh more than 60g then the price of the stamp increases accordingly.
